title: 107_hr5198
content: The Act may be cited as the "Premier Certified Lenders Program Improvement Act of 2002". The Premier Certified Lenders Program (PCLP) has been successful in helping small businesses expand. Increasing the number of premier certified lenders will provide more resources to small businesses. Requiring lenders to maintain unnecessarily large loss reserve accounts limits their ability to serve additional small businesses. Premier certified lenders should maintain loss reserve accounts based on the risk associated with the PCLP loan portfolio. Premier certified lenders in the PCLP should maintain loss reserve accounts based on the risk of loss associated with the loans to protect taxpayers and support small businesses' economic development. SEC. 3. ALTERNATIVE LOSS RESERVE FOR CERTAIN PREMIER CERTIFIED LENDERS. SEC. 3. ALTERNATIVE LOSS RESERVE FOR CERTAIN PREMIER CERTIFIED LENDERS. In General, Section 508(c) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to allow qualified high loss reserve PCLs to elect alternative loss reserve requirements instead of the standard ones. Contributions to the loss reserve are not required for the quarter if the election is made, based on the risk of loss. The company making the election must contribute to its loss reserve before the end of the quarter to ensure it is at least $25,000 and sufficient to protect the Federal Government from the risk of loss associated with PCLP loans. Qualified high loss reserve PCL refers to this specific type of reserve. The company must contribute to its loss reserve to ensure it is at least $25,000 and protect the Federal Government from the risk of loss associated with PCLP loans. Qualified high loss reserve PCL refers to companies designated as premier certified lenders meeting specific criteria. The company must maintain a sufficient loss reserve to protect the Federal Government from the risk of loss associated with its portfolio of PCLP loans. Third-party auditors certify the adequacy of the loss reserve quarterly for qualified high loss reserve PCLs and every 90 days for other companies. The company must maintain a sufficient loss reserve to protect the Federal Government from the risk of loss associated with its portfolio of PCLP loans. Third-party auditors certify the adequacy of the loss reserve quarterly for qualified high loss reserve PCLs and every 90 days for other companies. The term 'PCLP loan' refers to any loan guaranteed under this section. The term 'calendar quarter' is defined as specific periods throughout the year. The term 'calendar quarter' is defined as specific periods throughout the year, including January 1 to March 31, April 1 to June 30, July 1 to September 30, and October 1 to December 31. Additionally, a conforming amendment was made to the Small Business Investment Act of 1958.
